author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA...
summary: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... As of 11:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 34.4, -79.2 with movement N at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...CHANTAL MOVING INTO EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... ...FLASH FLOOD THREAT CONTINUES AS RAINBANDS MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL AND EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA... As of 11:00 AM EDT Sun Jul 06 the center of Chantal was located near 34.4, -79.2 with movement N at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Depression Chantal (AT3/AL032025)
